page.title: 02IMPRESSIONS OF LEAMINGTON.
page.content: Leamington is nice to live in. Because it's so small, if you go anywhere, you're bound to meet someone you know. The spa-water isn't nice, it's too salty. Leamington has a large number of concerts and annual events. Many of the local people are involved in these. Every year, we have a peace festival in the Pump Room Gardens. This land is now under threat from a building firm who want to build flats on it. This would mean that a large area of greenery would be lost. Will the Pump Room Gardens be here in 900 years time? The Parish Church is the third largest in England. Will it still be the same in 900 years?
